The beats are named kasmko (spoken ka) and woge (wo). The beat is stressed as follows:[B]| x x | [B]where x is a beat and | indicates a bar.

The Intricacy of Glistening is a devotional form of music originating in The Faint Cobra. The rules of the form are applied by composers to produce individual pieces of music which can be performed. Two singers recite nonsensical words and sounds while the music is played on a oyoli. The music is melody and rhythm without harmony. The entire performance should bring a sense of motion, and it is to be in whispered undertones. The melody has short phrases throughout the form. The music repeats for as long as necessary. It is performed using the atho scale. Throughout, when possible, composers and performers are to locally improvise and modulate frequently. From beginning to end, when improvising or composing, artists should sometimes include a falling melody pattern with sharpened sixth degree as well as trills, sometimes include a rising melody pattern with sharpened third degree and sharpened fifth degree as well as grace notes, rapid runs and arpeggios and sometimes include a falling-rising melody pattern with legato. [B]Each singer always does the main melody. [B]The oyoli always provides the rhythm. [B]The Intricacy of Glistening has a well-defined multi-passage structure: a lengthy passage, a finale and a coda. [B]The simple passage is at a walking pace. Each of the singers' voices stays in the high register. Chords are packed close together in dense clusters in this passage. The passage is performed in the cida rhythm. [B]The finale is moderately fast. Each of the singers' voices ranges from the middle register to the high register. This passage features only melodic tones and intervals. The passage is performed in the atha rhythm. [B]The coda accelerates as it proceeds. Each of the singers' voices ranges from the middle register to the high register. This passage typically has some sparse chords. The passage is performed in the cenopu rhythm. [B]Scales are conceived of as two chords built using a division of the perfect fourth interval into eleven notes. The tonic note is fixed only at the time of performance. After a scale is constructed, notes are named according to degree. The names are lari (spoken la), aratha (ar), imeri (im), thna (th), fidale (fi), tarathe (ta) and cuthefi (cu). [B]As always, the atho hexatonic scale is thought of as two disjoint chords drawn from the fundamental division of the perfect fourth. These chords are named adi and fomire. [B]The adi trichord is the 1st, the 7th and the 11th degrees of the fundamental perfect fourth division. [B]The fomire tetrachord is the 1st, the 3rd, the 7th and the 11th degrees of the fundamental perfect fourth division. [B]The cida rhythm is made from two patterns: the le (considered the primary) and the otoga. [B]The le rhythm is a single line with two beats. The beat is stressed as follows:[B]| x - | [B]where x is a beat, - is silent and | indicates a bar. [B]The otoga rhythm is a single line with two beats. The beat is stressed as follows:[B]| - x | [B]where x is a beat, - is silent and | indicates a bar. [B]The atha rhythm is a single line with eight beats. The beats are named alo (spoken al), avea (av), mafina (ma), pama (pa), bulifo (bu), ada (ad), icithi (ic) and arle (ar). The beat is stressed as follows:[B]| X x x - x - - x | [B]where X marks an accented beat, x is a beat, - is silent and | indicates a bar. [B]The cenopu rhythm is a single line with two beats. The beat is stressed as follows:[B]| x - | [B]where x is a beat, - is silent and | indicates a bar.

The Euphoria of Velvet is a form of music used during marches and military engagements originating in The Faint Cobra. The form guides musicians during improvised performances. A speaker recites any composition of The Saturninity of Strategy while the music is played on a ey, a fethida and a oyoli. The musical voices bring melody with harmony. The melody has phrases of varied length throughout the form. Pitches are densely packed in clusters as music moves from chord to chord. The music repeats for as long as necessary. It is performed in the licesi rhythm. Throughout, when possible, performers are to spread syllables over many notes. [B]The speaker always should be broad. [B]The ey always does the main melody and should be broad. The voice is confined to the wispy high register. [B]The fethida always does harmony and should perform with a light touch. [B]The oyoli always does the main melody. [B]The Euphoria of Velvet has a simple structure: a passage. [B]The simple passage is at a walking pace, and it is to be in whispered undertones. The passage is performed using the datome scale. The passage should be performed using glides. [B]Scales are conceived of as two chords built using a division of the perfect fourth interval into eleven notes. The tonic note is fixed only at the time of performance. After a scale is constructed, notes are named according to degree. The names are lari (spoken la), aratha (ar), imeri (im), thna (th), fidale (fi), tarathe (ta) and cuthefi (cu). [B]As always, the datome heptatonic scale is thought of as two disjoint chords drawn from the fundamental division of the perfect fourth. These chords are named warer and aweme. [B]The warer tetrachord is the 1st, the 2nd, the 6th and the 11th degrees of the fundamental perfect fourth division. [B]The aweme tetrachord is the 1st, the 2nd, the 7th and the 11th degrees of the fundamental perfect fourth division. [B]The licesi rhythm is made from two patterns: the emu and the pe. The patterns are to be played in the same beat, allowing one to repeat before the other is concluded. [B]The emu rhythm is a single line with twenty-nine beats divided into five bars in a 5-7-5-7-5 pattern. The beat is stressed as follows:[B]| x - - - x | x - x - x ! - | X x x x x | x - x x X x x | - x - - x | [B]where ! marks the primary accent, X marks an accented beat, x is a beat, - is silent and | indicates a bar. [B]The pe rhythm is a single line with thirty-two beats divided into eight bars in a 4-4-4-4-4-4-4-4 pattern. The beats are named amama (spoken am), thafatha (tha), etini (et) and le (l). The beat is stressed as follows:[B]| - x x - | - - - x | x x x X | - x X x | x - - x | - x x - | x x - - | - x - x | [B]where X marks an accented beat, x is a beat, - is silent and | indicates a bar.

The Venerable Wisps is a form of music used to commemorate important events originating in The Faint Cobra. The form guides musicians during improvised performances. A singer recites any composition of The Beloved Satin while the music is played on a oyoli. The musical voices bring melody with harmony. The melody has long phrases throughout the form. It is performed in free rhythm. Throughout, when possible, performers are to alternate tension and repose and spread syllables over many notes. [B]The singer always should be stately. [B]The oyoli always should bring a sense of motion and locally improvises. [B]The Venerable Wisps has a well-defined multi-passage structure: a chorus and a verse all repeated one to two times, a bridge-passage and a finale. [B]The chorus is voiced by the melody of the singer and the harmony of the oyoli. The passage is very slow, and it is to be loud. The singer's voice covers its entire range. This passage typically has some sparse chords. The passage is performed using the cebela scale. [B]The verse is voiced by the melody of the oyoli. The passage gradually slows as it comes to an end, and it is to become softer and softer. Chords are packed close together in dense clusters in this passage. The passage is performed using the aniye scale. [B]The bridge-passage is voiced by the melody of the oyoli. The passage is at a free tempo, and it is to become softer and softer. This passage typically has some sparse chords. The passage is performed using the aniye scale. [B]The finale is voiced by the melody of the singer and the melody of the oyoli. The passage is at a free tempo, and it is to be in whispered undertones. The singer's voice stays in the middle register. This passage is richly layered with full chords making use of the available range. The passage is performed using the atho scale. [B]Scales are conceived of as two chords built using a division of the perfect fourth interval into eleven notes. The tonic note is fixed only at the time of performance. After a scale is constructed, notes are named according to degree. The names are lari (spoken la), aratha (ar), imeri (im), thna (th), fidale (fi), tarathe (ta) and cuthefi (cu). [B]As always, the cebela heptatonic scale is thought of as two disjoint chords drawn from the fundamental division of the perfect fourth. These chords are named warer and fathinu. [B]The warer tetrachord is the 1st, the 2nd, the 6th and the 11th degrees of the fundamental perfect fourth division. [B]The fathinu tetrachord is the 1st, the 4th, the 8th and the 11th degrees of the fundamental perfect fourth division. [B]As always, the aniye hexatonic scale is thought of as two disjoint chords drawn from the fundamental division of the perfect fourth. These chords are named adi and aweme. [B]The adi trichord is the 1st, the 7th and the 11th degrees of the fundamental perfect fourth division. [B]The aweme tetrachord is the 1st, the 2nd, the 7th and the 11th degrees of the fundamental perfect fourth division. [B]As always, the atho hexatonic scale is thought of as two disjoint chords drawn from the fundamental division of the perfect fourth. These chords are named adi and fomire. [B]The fomire tetrachord is the 1st, the 3rd, the 7th and the 11th degrees of the fundamental perfect fourth division.

dance_form.description: The Umber Musics is a war dance originating in The Closed Hatchet. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by any composition of The Lark of Verses. The dancers perform in a double circle, moving quickly to the music's ingish rhythm. The grotesque flamboyant dance is punctuated by strong leaps, fluid raised arms and counterclockwise eighth turns. [B]The dance begins with the introduction of the music. This lively section is punctuated by runs. [B]The dance enters a new section with the passage of the music. This section is punctuated by intense arm carriage. [B]The dance enters a new section with the bridge-passage of the music. This vigorous section is punctuated by spins, powerful footwork and low raised right arms. [B]The dance enters a new section with the finale of the music. This energetic section is punctuated by large moves.

The Tin Aquamarine is a sacred solo dance originating in The Closed Hatchet. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Granite Amethyst. This dance is a refined artform, with three special positions to be mastered. The dance is punctuated by serene independent body movement and debauched spins. [B]The dance begins with the theme of the music. The dancer performs to the themor rhythm. This section is punctuated by debauched forward bends and passionate facial expressions. [B]The dance enters a new section with the variations on the theme of the music. The dancer performs faster and faster with the music. This subtle section is punctuated by passive kicks. [B]The thkut is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a sluggish leg lift with a sluggish arm carriage. [B]The cog is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a flamboyant hand gesture. [B]The selsten is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a high raised left arm.

The Poetic Intricacy is a participation dance originating in The Closed Hatchet. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by any composition of The Laces of Fanciness. The dancers perform in a circle, moving to the music's okag rhythm. The sprightly dance is punctuated by straight-lined hand gestures. [B]The dance begins with the theme of the music. The dancers perform slower and slower with the music. This section is punctuated by fluid counterclockwise half turns. [B]The dance enters a new section with the finale of the music. The dancers perform quickly with the music. This energetic aggressive sharp-edged section is punctuated by strong raised right arms.

The Fuchsia Style is a group performance dance originating in The Closed Hatchet. The rules of the form are applied by choreographers to produce individual dances which can be performed. The dance is accompanied by any composition of The Wondrous Chant. The dancers perform in a circle turning clockwise, moving with the music. The dance is punctuated by graceful hand gestures, understated raised right arms mirrored by group members and aggressive facial expressions. [B]The dance begins with the introduction of the music. The dancers perform to the fer rhythm. This energetic crude section is punctuated by jerking body level changes. [B]The dance enters a new section with the theme of the music. This section is punctuated by spirited straight walks and passive body level changes, with large moves. [B]The dance enters a new section with the variations on the theme of the music. This sprightly twisting graceful section is punctuated by low body level and passive spins. [B]The dance enters a new section with the bridge-passage of the music. The dancers perform to the ugath rhythm. This section is punctuated by weightless spins mirrored by group members. [B]The dance enters a new section with the finale of the music. The dancers perform to the dolush rhythm. This sinuous energetic section is punctuated by movement performed in retrograde by group members.

The Taupe Dessert is a sacred solo dance originating in The Poison of Scorching. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by any composition of The Amethyst Luxury. The dancer performs along a clockwise circle. This dance is a refined artform, with five special positions to be mastered. The dance is punctuated by energetic leaps. [B]The tbog is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a refined hand gesture with a fluid forward bend. [B]The stran is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be an expressive left leg lift with an elaborate backward bend, an elaborate arm carriage and a fluid hand gesture. [B]The sputo is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a crude backward bend with a delicate arm carriage, a high body level and a fluid hand gesture. [B]The umung is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a passionate hand gesture with an elaborate right leg lift, a crude raised arm and a high body level. [B]The ogur is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a low body level with a crude facial expression and a debauched arm carriage.

The Bride of Style is a solo performance dance originating in The Poison of Scorching. The rules of the form are applied by choreographers to produce individual dances which can be performed. The dance is accompanied by any composition of The Pregnancy of Pantomimes. The dancer performs very slowly with the music. The strong aggressive debauched dance is punctuated by flamboyant raised left arms, undulating runs and lively independent body movement. [B]The dance begins with the passages of the music. The dancer performs to the tuxxu rhythm. This section is punctuated by raised arms, twisting right kicks and joyous curved walks. [B]The dance enters a new section with the next passage of the music. The dancer performs to the osmze rhythm. This section is punctuated by raised arms.

The Silk of Styling is a solo performance dance originating in The Poison of Scorching. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Glittery Tone. The dancer performs quickly with the music. This dance is a refined artform, with five special positions to be mastered. The fluid dance is punctuated by expressive independent body movement, expressive spins and softly percussive footwork. [B]The dance begins with the theme of the music. This delicate section is punctuated by refined arm carriage and leftward bends. [B]The dance enters a new section with the variations on the theme of the music. The dancer performs to the smug rhythm. This section is punctuated by grotesque right leg lifts. [B]The dance enters a new section with the coda of the music. This twisting section is punctuated by intense arm carriage and right leg lifts. [B]The roz is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a passionate hand gesture. [B]The uxzo is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a vivacious facial expression with an aggressive arm carriage and a sluggish left leg lift. [B]The ostad is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a grotesque hand gesture with a low body level and a raised right arm. [B]The zspo is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a leftward bend with a powerful arm carriage and a low body level. [B]The mosl is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a debauched backward bend with a grotesque arm carriage and a high body level.

The Laces of Reticence is a social partner dance originating in The Poison of Scorching. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by any composition of The Pregnancy of Pantomimes. The dancers perform in a circle along an intricate path, moving very slowly with the music. The partners maintain open contact, communicating intent by pushing together constantly. There are partner changes throughout the dance with the lead advancing against the main line of motion. The dance is delicate. [B]The dance begins with the passages of the music. The dancers perform to the tuxxu rhythm. This sinuous section is punctuated by counterclockwise eighth turns, the leg lifts of the follower and curved walks.

The Pregnant Aquamarine is a war dance originating in The Realms of Blunting. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Wonders of Bewildering. The dancers perform in a single line, moving to the music's umo rhythm. The entire dance has a basic movement called the eman. There is a series of two steps in a circular pattern with an intense arm carriage. The dance is punctuated by forward bends and crude runs, with large moves. [B]The dance begins with the passage of the music. The dancers perform very quickly with the music. This section is punctuated by expressive backward bends, sinuous leaps and intense facial expressions. [B]The dance enters a new section with the finale of the music. The dancers perform quickly with the music. This sluggish section is punctuated by counterclockwise eighth turns and raised arms.

The Beloved Flute is a solo performance dance originating in The Realms of Blunting. The rules of the form are applied by choreographers to produce individual dances which can be performed. The dance is accompanied by any composition of The Adorable Song. This dance is a refined artform, with nine specific moves to be mastered. The dance is joyous. [B]The dance begins with the introduction of the music. The dancer performs slowly with the music. This section is jerking. [B]The dance enters a new section with the theme of the music. The dancer performs quickly with the music. This section is punctuated by body level changes, sharp-edged backward bends and lively clockwise quarter turns. [B]The dance enters a new section with the variations on the theme of the music. This section is punctuated by energetic counterclockwise eighth turns. [B]The dance enters a new section with the bridge-passage of the music. The dancer performs slower and slower with the music. This lively section is punctuated by sinuous raised right arms and leaps. [B]The dance enters a new section with the finale of the music. The dancer performs very slowly with the music. This section is punctuated by refined facial expressions. [B]The oth is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a forward bend with elaborate independent body movement, a refined facial expression and large footwork. [B]The ushav is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a straight-lined sway. [B]The asri is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a run with a raised right arm, a spirited hand gesture and independent body movement. [B]The odu is one of the fundamental dance moves. First, there is a right kick with an intense arm carriage. Then there is a large forward bend. [B]The ijat is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a high kick with an expressive spin and a vivacious body level change. [B]The iquob is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a spin with a raised left arm and a backward bend. [B]The cadem is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a leap with a spirited counterclockwise eighth turn. [B]The caquot is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a refined facial expression with an elaborate body level change and a sway. [B]The shibbi is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a large sway with a proud curved walk and a raised arm.

The Poetry of Desserts is a war dance originating in The Realms of Blunting. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Wonders of Bewildering. The dancers perform in a double circle turning counterclockwise, moving to the music's umo rhythm. The entire dance has a basic movement called the aro. There is a series of two steps in a square pattern. The fluid sinuous dance is punctuated by joyous independent body movement. [B]The dance begins with the passage of the music. The dancers perform very quickly with the music. This section is punctuated by proud straight walks. [B]The dance enters a new section with the finale of the music. The dancers perform quickly with the music. This section is punctuated by spins and powerful raised left arms.

The Fragrant Suitor is a sacred solo dance originating in The Realms of Blunting. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Sable Sparkles. This dance is a refined artform, with one special position to be mastered. The dance is lively. [B]The stral the fundamental dance position. There should be a passionate facial expression with a straight-lined rightward bend, a low body level and a straight-lined left leg lift.

The Mauve Adoration is a social group dance originating in The Realms of Blunting. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by any composition of The Adorable Song. The dancers perform in several lines turning counterclockwise. [B]The dance begins with the introduction of the music. The dancers perform slowly with the music. This vigorous section is punctuated by counterclockwise eighth turns. [B]The dance enters a new section with the theme of the music. The dancers perform quickly with the music. This section is punctuated by sinuous raised left arms, twisting runs and forward bends. [B]The dance enters a new section with the variations on the theme of the music. This expressive straight-lined section is punctuated by intense sway and clockwise half turns. [B]The dance enters a new section with the bridge-passage of the music. The dancers perform slower and slower with the music. This sprightly aggressive section is punctuated by straight-lined arm carriage performed in succession by group members and refined hand gestures. [B]The dance enters a new section with the finale of the music. The dancers perform very slowly with the music. This flamboyant section is punctuated by intense footwork.

The Wonder of Velvet is a sacred solo dance originating in The Realms of Blunting. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Sable Sparkles. This dance is a refined artform, with three special positions and seven specific moves to be mastered. The entire dance has a basic movement called the leto. There is a series of two steps in an intricate pattern with an expressive hand gesture and crude independent body movement. [B]The renal is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a high body level with a lively rightward bend. [B]The hoth is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a refined arm carriage with a high body level, a crude facial expression and a backward bend. [B]The omsuth is one of the fundamental dance positions. There should be a spirited leftward bend. [B]The birta is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a proud right leg lift with an energetic clockwise eighth quarter turn and a low body level. [B]The ring is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a vivacious leap with a proud facial expression and independent body movement. [B]The thora is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is an aborted kick. [B]The sut is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is passionate footwork with a body level change, a passionate raised left arm and a strong counterclockwise eighth turn. [B]The thothil is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a twisting kick with a sinuous body level change and an elaborate hand gesture. [B]The ari is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a strong raised left arm with a straight walk, a grotesque facial expression and a refined backward bend. [B]The umac is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a strong leap with delicate independent body movement, a fluid hand gesture and a repeated left kick.

The Wispy Silkinesses is a sacred group dance originating in The Fish of Strife. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Glimmer of Rhyme. The dancers perform in several lines. The serene dance is punctuated by body level changes and spins. [B]The dance begins with the theme of the music. The dancers perform faster and faster to the avea rhythm. This section is punctuated by delicate left kicks, clockwise half turns mirrored by group members and low body level. [B]The dance enters a new section with the bridge-passage of the music. The dancers perform slowly to the nanotha rhythm. This weightless soft section is punctuated by straight walks and expressive footwork, with movement mirrored by group members. [B]The dance enters a new section with the variations on the theme of the music. The dancers perform slower and slower to the dinade rhythm. This section is punctuated by sinuous leaps and low body level.

The Meandering Poetry is a war dance originating in The Fish of Strife. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Chartreuse Lute. The dancers perform in a single line along an improvised path, moving faster and faster to the music's cida rhythm. The energetic strong sensual dance is punctuated by independent body movement. [B]The dance begins with the introduction of the music. This section is punctuated by expressive counterclockwise quarter turns. [B]The dance enters a new section with the chorus of the music. This graceful undulating section is punctuated by clockwise quarter turns.

The Lyric of Intricacy is a war dance originating in The Fish of Strife. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Mauve Trumpets. The dancers perform in a double circle, moving quickly to the music's le rhythm. The energetic dance is punctuated by intense spins and spirited leaps. [B]The dance begins with the introduction of the music. This section is sprightly. [B]The dance enters a new section with the chorus of the music. This vivacious section is punctuated by debauched raised arms, with large moves. [B]The dance enters a new section with the verse of the music. This spirited section is punctuated by vivacious facial expressions and repeated left kicks. [B]The dance enters a new section with the bridge-passage of the music. This section is crude. [B]The dance enters a new section with the next verse of the music. This section is punctuated by proud raised left arms and fluid straight walks. [B]The dance enters a new section with the next chorus of the music. This aggressive section is punctuated by straight-lined raised left arms.

The Silkiness of Gloss is a social partner dance originating in The Fish of Strife. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by any composition of The Play of Songs. The dancers perform in a double circle turning clockwise, moving to the music's timafi rhythm. The partners rarely make contact, communicating intent briefly through spoken cues. This dance is a refined artform, with four specific moves to be mastered. The dance is punctuated by spirited footwork. [B]The dance begins with the theme of the music. The dancers perform slowly with the music. This lively section is punctuated by vigorous independent body movement. [B]The dance enters a new section with the variations on the theme of the music. The dancers perform slowly with the music. This sprightly straight-lined flamboyant section is punctuated by lively leg lifts and the energetic body level changes of the lead. [B]The lebeyu is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is flamboyant footwork with twisting movement along the line of dance from the follower and a spirited clockwise eighth quarter turn. [B]The efeye is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a weightless leap from the follower with a subtle spin from the lead and a proud facial expression. [B]The lemathe is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a calm spin with a jerking raised arm from the lead, debauched footwork and subtle independent body movement. [B]The abure is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a graceful curved walk from the follower with a strong hand gesture and a grotesque raised left arm.

The Lyric of Glimmering is a solo performance dance originating in The Barbarity of Rain. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Sensual Sweetness-Tone as the dancer acts out any composition of The Strategic Laces. The dancer performs along a counterclockwise circle, moving to the music's ron rhythm. The jerking grotesque dance is punctuated by clockwise eighth turns. [B]The dance begins with the introduction of the music. The dancer performs slower and slower with the music. This section is powerful, lively and proud. [B]The dance enters a new section with the passages of the music. The dancer performs very quickly with the music. This flamboyant sharp-edged section is punctuated by vigorous curved walks.

The Taupe Plays is a war dance originating in The Barbarity of Rain. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by any composition of The Music of Pantomimes. The dancers perform in a double circle turning clockwise, moving to the music's zaxo rhythm. The vigorous spirited dance is punctuated by low body level. [B]The dance begins with the theme of the music. The dancers perform very quickly with the music. This section is strong. [B]The dance enters a new section with the variations on the theme of the music. This sensual section is punctuated by expressive body level changes.

The Play of Cherishing is a sacred solo dance originating in The Barbarity of Rain. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Lyrical Styles. This dance is a refined artform, with six specific moves to be mastered. The vigorous dance is punctuated by energetic raised arms, aggressive clockwise quarter turns and curved walks. [B]The dance begins with the introduction of the music. The dancer performs quickly with the music. This section is punctuated by joyous runs. [B]The dance enters a new section with the passage of the music. This section is punctuated by right leg lifts. [B]The dance enters a new section with the next passages of the music. The dancer performs slowly with the music. This section is punctuated by sensual arm carriage. [B]The ulu is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a spin with a passionate repeated kick and a passionate facial expression. [B]The smug is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a large body level change with a refined rightward bend, joyous footwork and a spirited facial expression. [B]The tbog is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a proud forward bend with an aggressive facial expression, a lively run and independent body movement. [B]The stran is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a joyous spin. [B]The sputo is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a spin with a lively hand gesture, a powerful sway and grotesque independent body movement. [B]The umung is one of the fundamental dance moves. There is a leap with an intense raised left arm.

The Saturnine Petal is a participation dance originating in The Barbarity of Rain. The form guides dancers during improvised performances. The dance is accompanied by The Sensual Sweetness-Tone. The dancers perform in a single line, moving to the music's ron rhythm. The dance is energetic and twisting. [B]The dance begins with the introduction of the music. The dancers perform slower and slower with the music. This expressive section is punctuated by independent body movement. [B]The dance enters a new section with the passages of the music. The dancers perform very quickly with the music. This section is punctuated by proud curved walks.
